decks.notes: This deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature-based gameplay, leveraging disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board while ramping up with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude. The deck utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, alongside flicker effects such as Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate value and outpace opponents. By combining a graveyard recursion strategy with a disruptive aggro plan, this deck aims to overwhelm and outmaneuver opponents in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of fast, efficient creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to apply pressure early with cheap creatures like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional threats and ways to close out the game. The deck also includes some disruption with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to help maintain tempo and protect its creatures.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The creatures such as Ragavan and Guide of Souls provide early pressure, while cards like Phlage and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah offer additional offense and control. The deck also includes support cards like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to deal with opposing threats. With a mix of powerful creatures, burn spells, and versatile support cards, this deck aims to quickly close out games by attacking relentlessly while controlling the board.

The deck revolves around quickly getting powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand into play using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation. The deck combines instant speed reanimation with card advantage and control elements to overwhelm the opponent and win games in a fast and explosive manner. By carefully managing resources and timing plays, the deck aims to create a powerful board state and quickly close out games before the opponent can respond effectively.

Utilizing Eldrazi creatures and various support cards, this deck aims to quickly assemble a powerful board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature buffs, removal spells, and powerful Eldrazi finishers. The key strategy involves using the Broodscale Bloodchief as a centerpiece to generate value and create a threatening board state, while also utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the right combination of cards and sequencing, this deck can create explosive turns and quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The inclusion of cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Flickerwisp allows for tempo plays and disrupting the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes cards like Solitude for removal and Ephemerate for value. The mana base allows for consistent casting of spells and the deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total.

The main concept of this deck is to mill the opponent's deck as quickly and efficiently as possible. By using mill cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Archive Trap, and Fractured Sanity, the goal is to deplete the opponent's library to win the game. The deck also includes disruption cards like Fatal Push, Spell Pierce, and Drown in the Loch to control the opponent's plays and protect the milling strategy. Tasha's Hideous Laughter is a key card that can exile cards from the opponent's library based on their mana cost. The deck aims to win through the mill win condition while controlling the opponent's board and hand.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in order to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Mishra's Bauble provide additional flexibility and card advantage to assist in closing out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of cheap artifacts and creatures. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to ramp up mana quickly and deploy threats like Arcbound Ravager and Pinnacle Emissary. By utilizing cards that can generate additional value from artifacts in the graveyard or by sacrificing them, the deck aims to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan while pushing for a quick victory.

The deck focuses on assembling the Amulet of Vigor combo with Primeval Titan to generate powerful land-based advantages and potentially win the game in a single turn. By utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer, Explore, and Urza's Saga to ramp up mana and dig through the deck efficiently, the deck aims to consistently set up the combo while utilizing utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Vesuva to enhance its game plan. With access to cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith for additional synergy and resilience, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with explosive land plays.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping into big threats like Primeval Titan using cards like Amulet of Vigor and Green Sun's Zenith. It utilizes lands like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige to generate mana efficiently, while also running cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact for additional utility and consistency. The deck aims to assemble powerful combos to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly. With a mix of land tutors, ramp spells, and powerful threats, the deck is capable of explosive plays and quick victories in the Modern format.

The main idea of this Bant Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures, enchantments, and spells that disrupt their game plan while quickly building up a strong board presence. With cards like Fblthp, the Lost and Shardless Agent providing card advantage and tempo, alongside powerful enchantments like Witch Enchanter and Quantum Riddler, the deck aims to control the battlefield and outvalue the opponent. Using cards like Solitude and Force of Negation for removal and protection, the deck seeks to push through damage and secure victory with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on utilizing Ruby Storm cards to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for explosive combos that can deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. By casting spells such as Desperate Ritual and Manamorphose, the deck can chain together spells and generate additional resources with cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Pyretic Ritual. Valakut Awakening and Wish provide additional versatility and card advantage, while Past in Flames allows for spell recursion to keep the combo going. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and finish them off with a high-powered Grapeshot.

This deck focuses on creating an early board presence and tempo advantage by utilizing cards that provide both ramp and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Coiling Oracle and Ice-Fang Coatl, the deck aims to quickly establish control while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation. Birthing Ritual is a key card that allows for explosive plays, while cards like Subtlety and Harbinger of the Seas provide additional disruption. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption spells.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana and play big threats like Emrakul and Ugin. It uses control elements like Dismember and Portent of Calamity to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command and All Is Dust to gain advantage and clear the board. The deck's win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers, using a combination of removal and disruption to control the game and secure victory.
